summary: Retrieve exact line ranges from cached sources. Ideal for constructing grounded LLM prompts or verifying documentation statements.

usage.description: Preferred shorthand. Matches the `alias:lines` strings returned by `blz search`.
Flag-based form kept for backwards compatibility. Accepts comma-separated ranges or relative syntax (e.g., `36+12`).

options.impact: Expands each range by ±N lines. Use small numbers (1-5) to keep prompts tight.
Returns the entire markdown heading block containing the first range. Useful for API reference sections.
Cap the size of a block when used with `--block`.
Emits OSC 52 escape sequence so terminals like iTerm can copy results to the clipboard.
Machine-readable payload with alias, ranges, checksum, and text.

agent_playbook: Read alias + lines from the top hit in `blz search ... --format json`.
Call `blz get <alias>:<lines> --context 3 --format text` to pull a tidy snippet.
Include the checksum (available via JSON) in your tool output so downstream steps can verify integrity.
Favor short spans over entire pages—BLZ is optimized for surgical retrieval.
error_handling: If ranges fall outside the document, BLZ will return an error: re-run search to confirm the alias hasn't been removed or re-indexed.
When working with stale caches, run `blz update <alias>` and repeat the retrieval to refresh line numbers.
